location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is responding to a communication dated 5 November 1812, which requested a supply of sulphur to be sent via the Benaresto Bombay. It notes that the Resident plans to deviate from instructions and obtain the sulphur required locally, instead of from Muscat; it is explained that Muscat imports much of its sulphur from Bushire. It is noted that samples are being sent to Bombay for inspection by Government.
